entry.title: How to Deal With Toxic Change In CoinJoins
entry.summary:
Wasabi Wallet‚Äôs WabiSabi protocol is designed to eliminate change outputs from CoinJoins, better protecting Bitcoin users‚Äô privacy.
This is an opinion editorial by Thibaud Mar√©chal, ‚Äã‚Äãa contributor to privacy-focused Bitcoin wallet project Wasabi Wallet. Much ink has been spilled on the privacy horrors of change outputs for Bitcoin. It is now widely understood that Bitcoin is a pseudonymous network, where all users are identified by the addresses they use. When making a bitcoin transaction, instead of only sending the exact amount that is needed ‚Äî like in traditional, account-based payment systems ‚Äî you send all the sats from the original address into new ones. This creates a change output, which is the amount you get back when making a paymen‚Ä¶

Binance Announces Crypto Prepaid Card in Partnership With Movii Binance, the biggest cryptocurrency exchange in volumes traded, is making moves to expand its services in Colombia. The company announced the launch of a new prepaid cryptocurrency-linked card, that will allow users to pay with crypto in all merchants accepting standard debit and credit cards. entry.title: HSBC Acquires Silicon Valley Bank UK For 1 Pound
entry.summary:
HSBC UK, the ring-fenced subsidiary of HSBC, has acquired Silicon Valley Bank UK for ¬£1 ($1.21), according to a latest filing.
In a statement from the Treasury, it said the Bank of England oversaw the transaction with consultation from the UK Treasury to safeguard the deposits of Silicon Valley Bank UK customers.
HSBC Says Surprise SVB UK Buyout ‚ÄòMakes Excellent Strategic Sense‚Äô¬†
According to the filing, as of March 10, Silicon Valley Bank UK held loans totaling approximately $6.6 billion and deposits of roughly $8.1 billion.
‚ÄúThis acquisition makes excellent strategic sense for our business in the UK,‚Äù Noel Quinn, HSBC Group CEO, said.
‚ÄúIt strengthens our commercial banking franchise and enhances our ability to serve innovative and fast-growing firms, including in the techno‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin And Crypto This Week: These Events Will Be Crucial For Prices
entry.summary:
The Bitcoin and crypto markets are once again facing an extremely important week, which will be shaped not only by macro data, but also by the brewing US banking crisis. While at the beginning of last week the odds of a Fed rate hike of 50 basis points at the next FOMC meeting on March 22 were skyrocketing, the situation has changed dramatically.
These Events Will Be Crucial For Bitcoin And Crypto
This Monday morning at 8:00 a.m. (EST), the financial world will be looking at US President Joe Biden‚Äôs speech on the US banking crisis. Of particular interest to the crypto industry will be whether the US President scapegoats crypto for the collapse of the banks. Biden said, ‚ÄúI am committed to holding those responsible for this mess fully accountable.‚Äù
On the other hand, it will be crucial‚Ä¶

entry.title: Signature Bank Gets Shuttered By Regulators After SVB Collapse ‚Äì A Major Blow To Crypto?
entry.summary:
In an effort to avoid the spread of the banking¬†meltdown, authorities have announced the closure of another crypto-friendly bank ‚Äì New York-based Signature Bank ‚Äì¬†dealing a severe blow to the crypto industry.
State regulators pulled the plug on¬†Signature Bank on Sunday, March 12 ‚Äì the third largest failure in U.S. banking history ‚Äì two days after the¬†government took down Silicon Valley Bank in a failure that left billions of dollars in deposits unclaimed.
The potential clients of these lenders included a number of crypto firms. Signature and Silvergate were both proponents of digital asset liquidity that facilitated swift payments between clients, exchanges, and hedge funds.
FDIC Insures Deposits Up To $250,000
As news of Silicon Valley Bank‚Äôs difficulties circulated last week, S‚Ä¶

entry.title: Signature Bank Collapse: Coinbase, Paxos Disclose Massive Exposure
entry.summary:
Signature Bank became the third US bank institution to collapse in the span of four days. Similar to the now-collapsed Silvergate Bank, it also had a large corporate customer base from the cryptocurrency industry. The other one, Silicon Valley Bank (SVB), mostly tapped the technology sector, including crypto firms.

Signature Bank Collapses

New York state regulator, the Department of Financial Services, shuttered Signature Bank on Sunday "to protect depositors," putting it under the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) receivership.

The FIDC also took control of the SVB, but

entry.title: FBI Warns About Cryptocurrency Theft Scams Using Play-to-Earn Games
entry.summary: The FBI has issued a public service announcement (PSA) warning on the utilization of play-to-earn games as part of a scheme to defraud users of funds stored in the form of cryptocurrency. Criminals are introducing victims to this kind of game and then use malware to extract the funds from cryptocurrency wallets linked to the game, according to the bureau. FBI Issues PSA on Play to Earn Games Crypto Scheme The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is warning about the introduction of play-to-earn games in schemes destined to steal funds from unsuspecting users. On March 9, the institution issued a PSA on this, explaining how criminals are luring users to put funds behind play-to-earn games. According to the PSA, criminals establish a relationship with the selected victims, in order to gain ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bloxmith Launches Raiders Rumble, a Mobile Strategy Game for Both Web2 and Web3 Gamers, on the Flow Blockchain
entry.summary:
PRESS RELEASE. Taipei, March 13, 2023 ‚Äì Bloxmith, the player-first Web3 gaming studio, today announced that the open beta for Raiders Rumble, its unique 1v1 squad battler game for mobile powered by the Flow blockchain, is now available for download on Google Play and Apple App Store.
Raiders Rumble challenges players to apply fast-paced strategic decision making in countering the moves of their opponents. Built as a strategic esports game for the masses, it features a daily rotation of tournament modes where the top 50 percent of participants can win in-game items or RUMB tokens, Raiders Rumble‚Äôs project token.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term ‚Äúmetaverse‚Äù in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel ‚ÄúSnow Crash.‚Äù Now he‚Äôs helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in ‚ÄúSnow Crash,‚Äù goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next‚Äîincluding token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."
